books.title: Elantris
books.synopsis: The city of Elantris, once a place of magic and radiance, has fallen under a curse. When Prince Raoden is stricken by the Reod, he is exiled to the dead city, where he must uncover the secrets of Elantris to save his people and himself.

books.title: The Hope of Elantris
books.synopsis: A short story set during the events of Elantris, focusing on a side character's efforts to maintain order and hope amongst the children within the city.

books.title: The Emperor's Soul
books.book_order: N/A (Standalone novella set in the same world)
books.synopsis: Shai, a skilled Forger, is condemned to death but offered a chance at freedom if she can Forge a new soul for the comatose Emperor. She must delve into the nature of identity and art to succeed.
books.publisher: Tachyon Publications (novella), Dragonsteel Entertainment (in Arcanum Unbounded)

books.title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
books.synopsis: In a world of ash and mist, ruled by the tyrannical Lord Ruler, a young skaa thief named Vin discovers she is Mistborn and joins Kelsier's crew in a daring plan to overthrow the empire.

books.title: Mistborn: The Well of Ascension
books.synopsis: Following the Lord Ruler's defeat, Elend Venture struggles to lead the new kingdom while Vin grapples with ancient prophecies, a mysterious Deepness, and attacking armies.

books.title: Mistborn: The Hero of Ages
books.synopsis: The world is ending. Vin and Elend must decipher the truth behind the Deepness, the Well of Ascension, and the nature of the entity known as Ruin to save Scadrial from utter destruction.

books.title: Mistborn: Secret History
books.synopsis: A parallel story to the original Mistborn trilogy, revealing Kelsier's journey and actions in the Cognitive Realm after his death, significantly impacting Cosmere-wide events.

books.title: Mistborn: The Alloy of Law
books.synopsis: Centuries after the original trilogy, Scadrial is in an industrial era. Waxillium Ladrian, a lawman from the Roughs, is called back to the city of Elendel and, with his partner Wayne, investigates kidnappings and conspiracies.

books.title: Mistborn: Shadows of Self
books.synopsis: Waxillium, Wayne, and Marasi continue to protect Elendel. Unrest brews as they face a new threat with deep connections to Scadrial's past and the kandra, forcing Wax to confront his own history.

books.title: Mistborn: The Bands of Mourning
books.synopsis: The pursuit of the mythical Bands of Mourning, said to be the bracers of the Lord Ruler, takes Wax, Wayne, and Marasi on an expedition outside Elendel, uncovering secrets about southern Scadrians and advanced technology.

books.title: Mistborn: The Lost Metal
books.synopsis: Waxillium and his allies must confront the shadowy organization known as the Set and contend with the influence of another Shard, Autonomy, as Scadrial stands on the brink of a new technological and societal era, or potential disaster.

books.title: Warbreaker
books.synopsis: Two Idrian princesses, Vivenna and Siri, are sent to the vibrant, god-filled kingdom of Hallandren. They become entangled in political intrigue, the mysteries of BioChromatic Breath, and the plans of Vasher, a mysterious swordsman with a sentient blade.

books.title: The Way of Kings
books.synopsis: On the storm-swept world of Roshar, various characters—a tormented surgeon turned spearman, a young noblewoman scholar, and an assassin in white—begin journeys that will intertwine as ancient Knights Radiant are sought and the Voidbringers threaten return.

books.title: Words of Radiance
books.synopsis: As the True Desolation looms, Kaladin struggles with his new powers and responsibilities, Shallan delves deeper into the secrets of the Ghostbloods and her own past, and Dalinar Kholin fights to unite the Highprinces of Alethkar.

books.title: Edgedancer
books.synopsis: A novella focusing on Lift, a young Radiant with unique abilities, as she travels through Yeddaw, trying to understand her powers and responsibilities while evading capture by an old enemy.
books.publisher: Dragonsteel Entertainment (in Arcanum Unbounded), Tor Books (standalone novella)

books.title: Oathbringer
books.synopsis: Dalinar Kholin confronts his past as he seeks to unite Roshar against Odium's forces. The Knights Radiant are re-established, but internal conflicts and ancient enemies threaten to shatter the fragile alliance.

books.title: Dawnshard
books.synopsis: A novella following Rysn Ftori and Lopen as they embark on a dangerous expedition to the island of Akinah, seeking a legendary Dawnshard to aid in the war against Odium.

books.title: Rhythm of War
books.synopsis: The war against Odium intensifies. Coalition forces struggle against the Fused, Navani Kholin works to understand fabrials and the nature of Light, and Kaladin faces his deepest internal battles.

books.title: White Sand (Volume 1, 2, 3 - Prose version also exists)
books.synopsis: On the planet Taldain, Kenton is one of the last Sand Masters, who can control Invested sand. He must navigate political intrigue and betrayal to save his order and uncover the secrets of his world's magic.
books.release_date: Vol 1: 2016-06-28, Vol 2: 2018-02-20, Vol 3: 2019-09-10 (Prose originally 1999, unpublished until 2015 newsletter)
books.publisher: Dynamite Entertainment (Graphic Novels), Dragonsteel Entertainment (Prose excerpts/Arcanum Unbounded)

books.title: Arcanum Unbounded: The Cosmere Collection
books.synopsis: A collection of Cosmere novellas and short stories, including 'The Emperor's Soul,' 'The Hope of Elantris,' 'The Eleventh Metal,' 'Allomancer Jak and the Pits of Eltania,' 'Mistborn: Secret History,' 'White Sand' (excerpt & prose), 'Shadows for Silence in the Forests of Hell,' 'Sixth of the Dusk,' and 'Edgedancer,' along with essays on the planetary systems.

books.title: Shadows for Silence in the Forests of Hell
books.synopsis: On the dangerous planet Threnody, Silence Montane, a bounty hunter and innkeeper, navigates a deadly forest haunted by shades, protecting her family and business in a land where survival is paramount.
books.release_date: 2013 (in 'Dangerous Women' anthology), Dragonsteel Entertainment (in Arcanum Unbounded)
books.publisher: Tor Books (in Dangerous Women), Dragonsteel Entertainment (in Arcanum Unbounded)

books.title: Sixth of the Dusk
books.synopsis: Dusk, a trapper on the island world of First of the Sun, where magic comes from Aviar (birds granting cognitive abilities), encounters explorers from a technologically advanced offworld society, forcing him to confront the future of his people.
books.release_date: 2014 (in 'Shadows Beneath' anthology), Dragonsteel Entertainment (in Arcanum Unbounded)
books.publisher: Dragon Moon Press (in Shadows Beneath), Dragonsteel Entertainment (in Arcanum Unbounded)

books.title: Tress of the Emerald Sea
books.synopsis: Tress lives on a rock in an emerald-green spore sea. When her beloved is captured by the Sorceress of the Midnight Sea, Tress stows away on a ship and embarks on an adventure with a colorful pirate crew to save him.

books.title: Yumi and the Nightmare Painter
books.synopsis: Yumi, a Yoki-hijo chosen to stack sacred stones, and Painter, a nightmare painter on a world of darkness, find their lives inexplicably intertwined, forcing them to understand each other's worlds and powers to prevent disaster.

books.title: The Sunlit Man
books.synopsis: Nomad, a man fleeing across the Cosmere with a dark past and strange abilities, crash-lands on a planet where the sun is deadly. He must aid a local rebellion against oppressive forces while evading his pursuers.

books.title: Wind and Truth
books.synopsis: The concluding volume of the first arc of The Stormlight Archive. Dalinar Kholin's contest of champions with Odium looms, and the fate of Roshar and the wider Cosmere hangs in the balance as all forces converge.

planets.name: Threnody
planets.book_it_appears_in: Shadows for Silence in the Forests of Hell

planets.name: Canticle
planets.governing_shard: Unknown (Investiture present, but no known Shard)

shards.name: Ambition
shards.planet: Threnody (primarily, before Splintering), also active in the system where Mercy and Odium clashed.
shards.status: Splintered by Odium, with some of its power co-opted by Autonomy.
book_appearances: Mistborn: Secret History (mentioned)
The Stormlight Archive (mentioned in context of Odium's past actions)
Shadows for Silence in the Forests of Hell (implications of its lingering influence on Threnody)
shards.description: The drive to gain more, to strive, to achieve greater things, and to be more than one currently is. This Intent can be ruthless and uncaring in its pursuit of power and growth.
shards.investiture_description: The specific manifestations of Ambition's Investiture are not well-documented due to its early Splintering. On Threnody, its lingering power contributes to the dangerous nature of the Cognitive Realm (the Evil) and the shades.

shards.name: Autonomy
shards.planet: Taldain (primary known world), also has Avatars or influence on Patji (First of the Sun), Obrodai, and potentially others.
book_appearances: White Sand (Taldain)
Arcanum Unbounded: 'Sixth of the Dusk' (Patji as an Avatar's world)
The Lost Metal (mentions of Avatar on Obrodai, influence)
The Sunlit Man (mentions, influence)
shards.description: The desire for independence, self-sufficiency, and freedom from external control. It can also manifest as isolationism and a desire for others to also be separate and self-governing.
shards.investiture_description: On Taldain, Autonomy's Investiture manifests as Sand Mastery (control over Invested white sand) and the 'darkside' magic. Its Avatars on other worlds likely utilize or create unique forms of Investiture tied to Autonomy's Intent, such as the Aviar on First of the Sun.

shards.name: Cultivation
shards.status: Intact. Vessel is Koravellium Avast (a dragon). Has recently left Roshar after Odium's defeat.
book_appearances: The Stormlight Archive (series, direct appearances and major influence)
shards.description: The drive to grow, change, adapt, and foster development. This can be nurturing but also entails pruning or making hard choices for long-term growth, not always benevolent in the short term.
shards.investiture_description: Co-source of Surgebinding on Roshar with Honor. Associated with Lifelight. The Old Magic (boons and curses via the Nightwatcher) is a direct manifestation. Spren on Roshar are often a mix of Cultivation's and Honor's Investiture.

shards.name: Devotion
shards.status: Splintered by Odium. Its power, combined with Dominion's, forms the Dor.
book_appearances: Elantris (implications, history)
Mistborn: Secret History (mentioned)
shards.description: The drive to love, to be dedicated to, and to worship or be adored. It is an outward-focused Intent.
shards.investiture_description: Its power, mixed with Dominion's, forms the Dor, which is the source for Selish magics like AonDor (Elantris), Forgery (The Emperor's Soul), ChayShan, and Dakhor. These magics are heavily influenced by location and cultural forms.

shards.name: Dominion
shards.status: Splintered by Odium. Its power, combined with Devotion's, forms the Dor.
book_appearances: Elantris (implications, history)
Mistborn: Secret History (mentioned)
shards.description: The drive to control, to rule, to establish order and hierarchy, and to have power over a domain.
shards.investiture_description: Its power, mixed with Devotion's, forms the Dor, which is the source for Selish magics like AonDor (Elantris), Forgery (The Emperor's Soul), ChayShan, and Dakhor. These magics are heavily influenced by location and cultural forms.

shards.name: Endowment
book_appearances: Warbreaker (major influence and magic system origin)
shards.description: The drive to give, to bestow gifts, often without expectation of return. This is central to the concept of BioChromatic Breath.
shards.investiture_description: Manifests as BioChromatic Breath, an innate Investiture humans on Nalthis are born with and can transfer. Awakening is the magic system based on using Breaths to animate objects and grant them Commands. The Returned are also a direct result of Endowment's power.

shards.name: Honor
shards.status: Splintered by Odium. Vessel was Tanavast. His cognitive shadow persists to some degree, influencing the Stormfather.
book_appearances: The Stormlight Archive (series, major influence, flashbacks, and through the Stormfather)
shards.description: The drive to keep oaths, adhere to bonds and codes, and act with integrity and righteousness. It is about promises and the binding nature of agreements.
shards.investiture_description: Co-source of Surgebinding on Roshar with Cultivation. Associated with Stormlight. The Nahel bond between humans/singers and spren, and the Oaths of the Knights Radiant are central to his Investiture. Honorblades are powerful artifacts of Honor.

shards.name: Invention
shards.planet: Unknown (Implied to be mobile or not heavily Invested in a single, easily accessible world).
shards.status: Intact. Vessel is Chan Ko Sar.
book_appearances: The Lost Metal (mentioned by Harmony as difficult to contact)
The Sunlit Man (mentioned as having a perpendicularity and interactions with its denizens)
shards.description: The drive to create, innovate, discover, and build new things. Likely focused on technological or systemic creation.
shards.investiture_description: Largely unknown. Given its Intent, its Investiture likely fuels or enables the creation of advanced or unique technologies or systems. The 'great marvels' mentioned by Harmony suggest this. The inhabitants of the planet visited in *The Sunlit Man* utilize technology powered by its Investiture to 'shoot for the stars'.

shards.name: Mercy
shards.planet: Unknown (Active in the cosmere, location of primary investment not confirmed).
book_appearances: The Lost Metal (mentioned by Harmony as having been contacted, with a troubling response)
The Sunlit Man (mentioned in the context of past Shardic conflicts)
shards.description: The drive for compassion, forgiveness, and alleviating suffering. The exact nature of this Intent as a Shardic drive is still largely mysterious.
shards.investiture_description: Unknown. Its manifestations have not been depicted.

shards.name: Odium
shards.planet: Braize (prison within the Rosharan system), though his influence extends significantly to Roshar. Originally mobile throughout the cosmere.
shards.status: Intact. Original Vessel Rayse was killed. New Vessel is Taravangian, who reinterpreted the Intent, calling it Passion. However, the underlying Shard is still Odium.
book_appearances: The Stormlight Archive (series, primary antagonist)
Mistborn: Secret History (mentioned as having Splintered other Shards)
shards.description: The drive of divine hatred, rage, and intense, often destructive, emotion. Taravangian is attempting to guide it as 'Passion' more broadly, but its core nature remains a potent, dangerous force.
shards.investiture_description: Source of Voidbinding and the power of the Fused and Unmade on Roshar. Associated with Voidlight. His Investiture often corrupts or twists other forms of Investiture and beings.

shards.name: Preservation
shards.status: Effectively Splintered/Diffused after original Vessel Leras died. Its power later merged with Ruin's to form Harmony. A small remnant of Leras's mind persisted in the kandra an ETM.
book_appearances: Mistborn Era 1 (major influence, direct interaction)
Mistborn: Secret History (major role)
shards.description: The drive to maintain things as they are, to prevent change, and to protect and sustain. It is a force of stasis and endurance.
shards.investiture_description: The source of Allomancy on Scadrial. Its power manifested as the mists (before Harmony) and the Well of Ascension. Lerasium is its God Metal, capable of creating Mistborn.

shards.name: Ruin
shards.status: Effectively Splintered/Diffused after original Vessel Ati died. Its power later merged with Preservation's to form Harmony.
book_appearances: Mistborn Era 1 (primary antagonist)
Mistborn: Secret History (major role)
shards.description: The drive for decay, destruction, entropy, and the inevitable end of all things. It seeks to break down and return everything to a base state.
shards.investiture_description: The source of Hemalurgy (though Hemalurgy can be used with any Investiture, Ruin particularly understood and promoted it) and influenced Feruchemy's destructive aspects. Atium was its God Metal, allowing sight into the future. Its power was often subtle, influencing minds and events towards destructive ends.

shards.name: Valor
shards.planet: Unknown (Location of primary investment not confirmed, though some theories point to a possible connection with the Rosharan system or its periphery).
shards.status: Intact. Original Vessel was Medelantorius (a dragon). Current Vessel unknown if different.
book_appearances: The Lost Metal (mentioned by Harmony as having been contacted and potentially reasonable)
The Sunlit Man (mentioned, interactions with Hoid in the past)
shards.description: The drive for bravery, courage, and standing strong against adversity. The exact nature of this Intent as a Shardic drive is still largely mysterious.
shards.investiture_description: Unknown. Its manifestations have not been depicted.

shards.name: Virtuosity
shards.status: Splintered. Vessel unknown. Its Investiture forms the Nightmare Painting creatures.
book_appearances: Yumi and the Nightmare Painter (major influence and source of the conflict/magic)
shards.description: The drive for artistic skill, excellence in craft, and perhaps beauty and aesthetic perfection. Its Splintering on Komashi led to Investiture that reacts to creativity and manifests as both helpful and harmful spirits (hijo and nightmares).
shards.investiture_description: On Komashi, its Investiture is tied to the 'hijo' (spirits that aid in crafts) and the 'nightmares' (Invested creatures that attack, seemingly born from or influenced by artistic endeavor and perception). The magic involves interacting with these Invested spirits, often through artistic or skilled acts.

shards.name: Whimsy
shards.planet: Unknown (Location of primary investment not confirmed).
book_appearances: The Lost Metal (mentioned by Harmony as not being particularly useful regarding Odium)
shards.description: The drive for fancifulness, caprice, unpredictability, and perhaps playfulness or erratic behavior. The exact nature of this Intent as a Shardic drive is still largely mysterious.
shards.investiture_description: Unknown. Its manifestations have not been depicted.

shards.name: Harmony (Successor Shard)
shards.status: Intact (though struggling with the dual Intents). Vessel is Sazed. Formed from the merging of Ruin and Preservation.
book_appearances: Mistborn Era 2 (major influence, direct interaction)
The Lost Metal (major role)
shards.description: The combined Intent of Ruin and Preservation, leading to a desire for balance between progress/change and stability/stasis. This creates an internal conflict for the Vessel, as the two Intents are often opposed.
shards.investiture_description: Oversees and is the source of the combined Scadrian magics (Allomancy, Feruchemy, Hemalurgy). Can create both Preservation-aspected (lerasium) and Ruin-aspected (atium, now harmonium/ettmetal which has its own unique properties) God Metals. His Investiture is a blend of the two previous Shards.

investiture.name: Surgebinding
investiture.description: A system of magic that grants the ability to manipulate fundamental forces known as Surges, often through bonds with spren.

investiture.name: Voidbinding
investiture.description: A mysterious and dangerous magic system that manipulates Surges via the power of Odium, often associated with the Unmade and Voidlight.

investiture.name: Old Magic
investiture.description: A unique magic system involving boons and curses granted by the Nightwatcher, a powerful spren.

investiture.name: Allomancy
investiture.description: A metal-based magic system that allows users to ingest and 'burn' metals to grant various physical and mental abilities.

investiture.name: Feruchemy
investiture.description: A metal-based magic system that allows users to store attributes in metals for later use.

investiture.name: Hemalurgy
investiture.description: A destructive magic system that steals powers from others by driving metal spikes through their bodies.

investiture.name: AonDor
investiture.description: A form of magic that uses drawn symbols called Aons to produce various effects, powered by the Dor.

investiture.name: ChayShan
investiture.description: A magic system that uses specific movements and martial arts to channel the Dor for various effects.

investiture.name: Forgery
investiture.description: A magic system that rewrites the history of objects using soulstamps, temporarily changing their nature.

investiture.name: Bloodsealing
investiture.description: A magic system that uses blood and stamps to create seals for tracking or animation.

investiture.name: Awakening
investiture.description: A magic system that uses BioChromatic Breath to animate objects or grant various powers.

investiture.name: Sand Mastery
investiture.description: A magic system that allows users to manipulate white sand, typically by dehydrating themselves.

investiture.name: Aviar Abilities
investiture.description: A system where birds called Aviar grant magical abilities to their bonded humans, such as hiding from detection.

investiture.name: Shade Survival
investiture.description: A system involving rituals and rules to survive the predatory shades on Threnody.

investiture.name: Aetherbinding
investiture.description: A system involving symbiotic bonds with aethers, granting control over various substances.

investiture.name: Hion Lines
investiture.description: A magic system using colored energy lines for transportation and other effects.

investiture.name: Sunheart
investiture.description: A system where individuals absorb and use energy from the sun, granting superhuman abilities.
